thread.title: Meyer, Riordan back on best-seller list
thread.title_full: Meyer, Riordan back on best-seller list

title: Meyer, Riordan back on best-seller list
text:
The front and back jackets of the 'Twilight' 10th anniversary edition, which features the new book 'Life and Death.' (Photo: Little, Brown)
CONNECT 15 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Here’s a look at what’s new on USA TODAY’s Best-Selling Books list…
Happy anniversary: Stephenie Meyer’s surprise two-books-in-one 10th anniversary edition of her teen vampire love story Twilight seems to be a must-have among Twihards. Twilight Tenth Anniversary/Life and Death lands at No. 5. (The full list will publish on Thursday.)
The edition, with two jackets, includes the original mega-hit Twilight plus Life and Death , a new retelling in which she reverses the story: it’s now a human boy in love with a vampire girl. (Edward and Bella become Edythe and Beau.)
“It's been oddly joyful for me to get to spend time with my old characters in a new form,” says Meyer, who shocked fans last week with news the book was on sale. “I had a fantastic time creating this version, and I hope the readers enjoy it just as much.”
USA TODAY
Meyer calls latest effort 'not a real book'
But the best-selling author also admitted at New York Comic Con last week that the gender-swapping version “is not a real book, and I am totally aware of this.”
No matter. The anniversary edition sold 125,000 copies across all formats its first week, according to publisher Little, Brown.
Twilight , New Moon, Eclipse and Breaking Dawn all hit No. 1 on USA TODAY’s list, and the series became a hugely successful movie franchise starring Kristen Stewart and Robert Pattinson. The Twilight Saga has sold 155 million copies worldwide.
'Magnus Chase and the Gods of Asgard: The Sword of Summer' by Rick Riordan (Photo: Disney)
'Magnus' opus: Rick Riordan’s rabid fan base is following him to the next mythological adventure. The kids’ author has his seventh USA TODAY No. 1 best seller with Magnus Chase and the Gods of Asgard, Book One, The Sword of Summer (Disney). The novel, which makes its debut this week in the top spot, launches a new Norse mythology series for the author of the popular Percy Jackson & the Olympians , Kane Chronicles and Heroes of Olympus books.
Magnus Chase has a huge first printing of 2.5 million copies.
USA TODAY
Read an excerpt from new Rick Riordan
Magnus is a troubled kid who has been living on the streets of Boston since his mother’s death. One day he's tracked down by a man he's never met — who tells him he’s the son of a Norse god.
Riordan is already toiling away on the next Magnus story: The Hammer of Thor is due on Oct. 4, 2016.
